section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Ranges and Ovens

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Clearances
body: Freestanding or built-in ranges shall have a vertical clearance above the cooking top of not less than 30 inches (762 mm) to unprotected combustible material. Reduced clearances are permitted in accordance with the listing and labeling of the range hoods or appliances. The installation of a listed and labeled cooking appliance or microwave oven over a listed and labeled cooking appliance shall be in accordance with Section M1504.1. The clearances for a domestic open-top broiler unit shall be in accordance with Section M1505.1.

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Cooking Appliances
body: Cooking appliances shall be listed and labeled for household use and shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions. The installation shall not interfere with combustion air or access for operation and servicing. Electric cooking appliances shall comply with UL 1026 or UL 858. Solid-fuel-fired fireplace stoves shall comply with UL 737.

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Sauna Heaters

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Locations and Protection
body: Sauna heaters shall be protected from accidental contact by persons with a guard of material having a low thermal conductivity, such as wood. The guard shall not have a substantial effect on the transfer of heat from the heater to the room.

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Installation
body: Sauna heaters shall be installed in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions. Sauna heaters shall comply with UL 875.

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Combustion Air
body: Combustion air and venting for a nondirect vent-type heater shall be provided in accordance with Chapters 17 and 18, respectively.

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Controls
body: Sauna heaters shall be equipped with a thermostat that will limit room temperature to not greater than 194°F (90°C). Where the thermostat is not an integral part of the heater, the heat-sensing element shall be located within 6 inches (152 mm) of the ceiling.

title: Section M1903

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Gaseous Hydrogen Systems

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Installation
body: Gaseous hydrogen systems shall be installed in accordance with the applicable requirements of Section M1307.4 and the Florida Building Code, Fuel Gas, the Florida Fire Prevention Code and the Florida Building Code, Building.

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Residential Permanently Installed Stand-by Generators

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Listed and Labeled
body: Permanently installed stand-by generators regulated by this code shall be listed and labeled for the application in which they are installed and used.

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Installation
body: Installation of permanently installed stand-by generators shall comply with manufacturer's installation instructions and listing conditions.

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Electrical Installation
body: Electrical installation of permanently installed stand-by generators shall comply with the applicable provisions of NFPA 70, National Electrical Code, manufacturer's installation instructions, and conditions of the listing.

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Flood Hazard
body: In flood hazard areas as established by Table R301.2(1), permanently installed stand-by generators shall be located or installed in accordance with Section R322.1.6.

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Fuel Gas
body: Fuel gas installation for permanently installed stand-by generators shall comply with the applicable provisions of Chapter 24 of this code.

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Liquid Fuel
body: Liquid fuel installation for permanently installed stand-by generators shall comply with the applicable provisions of NFPA-30.

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Wind Resistance
body: Permanently installed standby generators that are exposed to wind shall be designed and installed to resist the wind pressures determined in accordance with this code.

section: Chapter 19 Special Appliances, Equipment and Systems
title: Exhaust Location
body: Permanently installed residential standby generator's exhaust shall be located to not create a nuisance. Exhaust termination shall be a minimum of 10 feet (3048 mm) from any openings that could allow fumes into the building (doors, operable windows, eave vents, etc.) or air intakes.Exception:The generator exhaust can be located a minimum of 5 feet (1524 mm) from any such openings (doors, operable windows, eave vents, etc.) or in compliance with generator manufacturer installation requirements and listing, whichever is more restrictive, if all of the following are complied with:A carbon monoxide (CO) alarm(s) is installed in the residency within 10 feet (3048 mm) of each room used for sleeping purposes, or in accordance with the alarm's manufacturer installation requirements and listing, whichever is more restrictive.An additional carbon monoxide (CO) alarm is installed in the residency as close as possible to the building's exterior opening nearest to the generator exhaust.The carbon monoxide (CO) alarms mentioned above shall be of the types required by Sections R315.1.1 or R315.1.2 of this code.
